page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY W. LEOMINSTER
page.content: Barons' Cross, the main residential part of West Leominster, derives its name from the Marcher Lords in King John's reign. The Marcher Lords met there to discuss plans which resulted in the signing of the Magna Carta. Nearby is Cursneh Hill, an ancient fortified earthwork. During the Wars of the Roses the Yorkists were entrenched on Cursneh Hill and were driven off by mixed forces of Welsh and Irish troops. During the Wars of the Roses many troops came through this area, as the Battle of Mortimer's Cross was only about half a mile outside the area.
